intro: Vanhouttea lanata, commonly known as the woolly vanhouttea, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. Its leaves are typically opposite and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its unique texture. Vanhouttea lanata produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often attracting various pollinators.
